Header: Seven billion rupees allocated for new industries
Content: Deputy Minister Buddhika Pathirana says 7 billion rupees has been set aside by the budget to establish new industries island wide. The Deputy Minister made the comment when he inspected issues of the entrepreneurs who have invested in the Poon-thottam industrial park in Vavuniya. The Deputy Minister also discussed about possible solutions for their issues. Addressing journalists following the visit, Deputy Minister Buddhika Pathirana said that the government intends to provide more concessions to entrepreneurs in the Northern and Eastern parts of the country who were affected by a gruesome war. He pointed out that the government wants to create many employment opportunities through entrepreneurs. Buddhika Pathirana explained that the government has already ponded to embark a dedicated industrial zone for women.
